telling me to blow him and all that was part of the entertainment value.  So I, of course, was upset.

see this is what i meant before about you not knowing what you were doing donnie.  what do you think the report function is?  it's a tool built for one and only one purpose which is to ask youtube to take the video down and potentially strike the channel.  which means if you ask someone to flag a video you're asking them to try to get that video taken down and for them to affect the monetization.  If a strike's applied to a video, depending on which strike it is, here are some things that can happen.  The first strike bans you from uploading, doing live streams, making stories, custom thumbnails, or community posts for a week.  So it's basically a week's suspension from creation, which of course can have a direct financial impact.  The second strike's the same thing, but for two weeks.  And on the third strike, your channel is permanently deleted.  This is why YouTubers hate false flagging so much, Donnie.  It's not a joke, it's not something to be taken lightly, it's a serious attack against another YouTuber with no purpose other than to directly attack their channel and income.  Now obviously it's different when the flag's actually valid, and not just done out of retribution for hurt feelings.  There are some videos that really should be removed.  Not that many, but some.  But videos debunking arguments that you would rather were not debunked do not fall into that category.  When you do this stuff, you're lying to YouTube, telling them the videos are against the community guidelines, even though you know they're not, hoping YouTube won't look too closely, make a mistake, and delete them, and strike the channel anyway.  If you didn't realize this, fine, I forgive you for your ignorance this time, but this is a very important thing for you to understand going forward.
